header.title: AFK Manager Mod
header.description: The Away From Keyboard (AFK) Manager Mod allows users to toggle their AFK status, submit an AFK reason and an automatic post to a specific forum (defined by admin in the ACP) all from their own supplied AFK Manager UCP module.
header.author-notes:
User Features:
- AFK Status: On/Off - AFK Reason: Select from a list the reason for being AFK - Auto Post Message: If Auto Posting is enabled, custom message will be posted into a forum (defined by Admin) to alert other users as to the users AFK status and reason.
Admin Features:
- Auto Post: If Auto Post is enabled, users custom message will be posted to a forum defined by Auto Post Forum ID setting. If Auto Post is disabled, no message will be posted. - Auto Post Forum ID: Select form a list of forums the forum that is to contain the AFK Auto Posts (If Auto Post is enabled) - Auto Post Reply: If enabled (and Auto Post is enabled), a user toggling their status back from AFK will Auto Post a reply to their Auto Post AFK topic, telling other users they have returned from being AFK. If disabled (and Auto Post is enabled), a user toggling their status back from AFK will post a New Post telling others they have returned from being AFK. - AFK User List: A table that shows the current users that have toggled their AFK status, the date they went AFK, how long they have been AFK, their chosen AFK reason and their AFK Auto Post ID (If Auto Post is enabled) - Permissions are required to use/view AFK Manager UCP module, AFK User List module and AFK Settings module.

edit.comment: This edit is required to allow log entries in the admin ACP when a user changes their AFK status.

action-group.diy-instructions: 1. Copy over files. 2. Go to install/index.php in your browser and install the AFK Manager Mod 3. Make the required edits. 4. Purge Cache. 5. Refresh your templates/themes/imagesets. 6. Delete the install folder after installation.
